title: Global Events Data Analyst
job_description:
Locations
: Lisbon | Heredia
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
What You'll Do
You Will Be Supporting BCG’s Efforts To Move Towards a More Audience-centric Event Portfolio Through Stronger Targeting Efforts And Enhanced Data Quality. You Will Work With The Global External & Events Analytics Director And Collaborate Closely With Event Projects Teams To
- Work hand in hand with event project team to strengthen and streamline data management in event planning process, including invitations and on the ground 1:1 client engagement coordination
- Manage end to end invitation process, from list generation, to invitations, registration sites, and all communications with invitees, using the appropriate marketing technology platforms (e.g., Microsoft Dynamics, Marketo, Cvent)
- Coordinate 1:1 client engagement process from target selection, matchmaking with BCG delegate, and approvals
- Support event project team on ad-hoc data cleaning needs
- Support event analytics team on ad-hoc reporting needs
YOU’RE GOOD AT
- Working in cross-functional teams (inside and outside of marketing), especially in a virtual setting
- Managing multiple sets of data across tools and spreadsheets
- Exceptional attention to detail and excellent coordination and organization skills, with the ability to manage multiple inputs and to organize data effectively
- Communicating effectively (written and verbal) to all stakeholders in an accurate and in a service-orientated way (in English)
- Working in a structured, autonomous and process orientated way
What You'll Bring
- BA/BS degree
- Two or more years of relevant practical experience in events or data management
- Advanced Excel proficiency
- Experience and knowledge of marketing and event technologies such as Microsoft Dynamics, Marketo, Cvent
- Curiosity around new technologies and GenAI applications to day-to-day work
- Ability to work in autonomy with good planning/organization skills and exceptional attention to detail
- Must have a positive and friendly manner, with a strong service orientation, high degree of flexibility, and the ability to work under pressure
- Ability to interact with intercultural teams at senior and junior levels in a non-hierarchical manner
Who You'll Work With
- Global External Relations & Events team
- Local and Practice Area marketing teams
- Global Digital and MarTech teams
- Meeting & Events Operations & Technology team
